pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [x] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #10776 

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10776~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

How much do you care about the non `ContinuousSMul` case? The reason I'm asking this is because, if you assume this and that the field is nontrivially normed (which you can always do), it turns out that `S` is bounded iff for all neighborhood `V` of zero, there is **some** scalar `r â‰  0` such that `r â€¢ S âŠ† V`. We don't have this yet (which is a shame, it could probably be used to simplify a bunch of proofs, although the assumptions are rather strong), but it is essentially a direct consequence of [nhds_basis_balanced](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/LocallyConvex/BalancedCoreHull.html#nhds_basis_balanced). 
Once you have that, your result is easier to prove, since you can just take the product of one such element on each factor.

I don't care about spaces without `ContinuousSMul`. OTOH, if we already have a proof that works, then why decrease generality? Also, I don't think that the proof will be much shorter without `[Finite Î¹]`. Again, I don't care about the case `[Infinite Î¹]` but why not save a TC search every time we use the theorem?

The finiteness part shouldn't be a problem, you still have a neighborhood of zero in a product so you can ignore all components on which your neighborhood is `univ`. 

My point was mostly to have a more natural proof, I'm not a big fan of the idea that we end up doing a more complicated proof (maybe shorter in total lines of code of course, but I don't think that's the right metric for complexity) just for the sake of generality that we will never use.

I'm okay with keeping this proof for now because I know you have things which depend on it, I'm just a bit worried that later attempts to simplify this proof would be turned down because of "loss of generality".
My goal is to have some form of this statement merged. I only need it as a dependency for topology on `ContinuousMultilinearMap`s.
@ADedecker What do you want me to do with this PR to get it merged?

Sorry for the delay.

Let's merge this as is, I'll try to find some time soon to try the approach I suggested.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8411093169/job/23030287100)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8411093169/job/23030286749)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8411093169/job/23030287016)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: image of a von Neumann bounded set under a multilinear map

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Multilinear/Topology): define topology on `ContinuousMultilinearMap`s
